title: Aluminum Price Hits Three-Year High at $2,920/Tonne
summary: Aluminum prices surged to a three-year high of $2,920 per tonne due to supply shortages caused by China's production caps amid rising global demand. The price momentum is supported by strategic production quotas, raw material quality issues, energy cost pressures, and infrastructure bottlenecks, with strong institutional buying and tight inventory levels on the London Metal Exchange.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
summary: Aluminum prices rose to $2,873.60 per tonne on November 28, 2025, up 1.42% from the previous day, rebounding from a near one-month low. Despite a slight monthly decline of 0.38%, prices remain 10.48% higher than a year ago, supported by macroeconomic factors including potential rate cuts and stimulus measures in China.

title: Alcoa: High US Aluminum Prices Offset Trump Tariff Costs
summary: Alcoa reported that U.S. tariffs on Canadian aluminum increased costs by $69 million in the prior quarter, but rising domestic aluminum prices have more than offset these tariff impacts. The company expects tariff-related costs to rise further in Q4, reflecting ongoing trade tensions and their effects on the U.S. aluminum market.

title: Premiums for aluminum in U.S. reach record highs
summary: U.S. aluminum premiums have reached record highs, reflecting tight supply and strong demand conditions in the domestic market. This trend is influenced by trade policies and supply chain dynamics affecting North American aluminum pricing.

title: JPMorgan stated that aluminum prices are expected to approach $3000 per mt in Q1 2026
summary: JPMorgan forecasts aluminum prices to approach $3,000 per metric ton in the first quarter of 2026, driven by rising copper prices and favorable market conditions for base metals. This outlook suggests continued strength in aluminum pricing into early 2026.

title: Off-season atmosphere deepens, proportion of liquid aluminum expected to drop further in December
summary: Domestic aluminum production in November 2025 increased 1.47% year-on-year but fell 2.82% month-on-month as the industry transitioned into the off-season. The proportion of liquid aluminum dropped to 77.3%, with a forecasted further decline to 76.6% in December due to lower downstream demand and new processing capacity coming online.

title: Aluminum Rod: Inventory Drawdown, Fees Bottoming Out; Cable Operating Rate Up, Demand Weakness Persistent (SMM Analysis)
summary: As of late November 2025, aluminum rod inventory days decreased to 6.68, signaling a drawdown trend and easing supply pressure. Processing fees remain low, and while cable operating rates improved slightly, demand remains weak due to seasonal and year-end factors.

title: AI Data Centers Crush Aluminum Industry with Power Demand
summary: US aluminum smelters are struggling to compete for electricity as tech giants pay premium rates to power AI data centers, increasing pressure on aluminum production capacity and raising concerns about future supply.

title: Sortera Raises $45 Million to Scale AI Driven Aluminum Upcycling
summary: Sortera secured $45 million to expand its AI-enabled aluminum sorting platform and build a second U.S. facility in Tennessee by summer 2026. The technology transforms mixed aluminum scrap into targeted alloys, reducing energy demand by up to 95% compared to virgin metal production, significantly lowering carbon emissions and supporting domestic circular manufacturing.

title: The Rise of AI-Driven Aluminum Recycling and Sortera's Path to a $10B Market Opportunity
summary: Sortera Technologies leads AI-driven aluminum recycling achieving 98% purity and 95% energy savings over primary production. Supported by $45M funding and partnerships, the company targets aerospace and automotive sectors with high-value alloy sorting, positioning the market to grow at 4.83% CAGR to 49.82 million tons by 2030, driven by ESG mandates and carbon pricing.

title: Unilever, Ball and Alcoa unveil “first” carbon-free aluminum aerosol can
summary: Unilever, Ball Corporation, and Alcoa introduced the first aerosol can made using Elysis carbon-free smelting technology, combining 50% Elysis aluminum with 50% recycled content. This innovation eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions from smelting by producing oxygen instead of CO2, marking a significant step in decarbonizing aluminum packaging for personal care products.

title: Aerosol can features Elysis primary aluminum, recycled content
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever partnered to launch an aerosol can using Elysis carbon-free smelting technology, combining 50% primary aluminum and 50% post-consumer recycled content. The proprietary process eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions by using inert anode technology, supporting global decarbonization goals and consumer demand for sustainable packaging.

title: Researchers make incredible breakthrough using material from old cars
summary: A new recycled aluminum alloy called RidgeAlloy has been developed to address the challenge of recycling aluminum from old cars. The alloy is tough and energy-efficient, reducing processing energy by up to 95% compared to primary aluminum. This innovation supports automotive lightweighting and sustainability goals with rapid development from concept to production in 15 months.

title: Samsung's T7 Resurrected SSD Uses 100% Recycled Aluminum
summary: Samsung launched the T7 Resurrected portable SSD featuring a body made entirely from recycled aluminum scraps generated during Galaxy smartphone production. The product also uses recyclable packaging, reflecting Samsung's commitment to sustainability and circular economy principles in technology manufacturing.

title: Steel Rebounds to Highest in November
summary: Steel prices in China rose to 3,124 CNY/T on November 28, 2025, up 1.00% from the previous day, driven by lower supply amid a 12% annual drop in crude steel output in October. The price remains 6.66% lower than a year ago, reflecting ongoing market adjustments due to anti-overcapacity policies.

title: HRC Steel Hits 31-week Low
summary: HRC Steel prices rose to 904 USD/T on November 28, 2025, up 0.33% from the previous day, with a 6.73% monthly increase and a 29.14% year-on-year rise. However, the price recently hit a 31-week low, reflecting ongoing volatility in the global steel market.

title: SSAB Americas Raises Prices for Rolled Steel by at Least $40/t
summary: For the week of November 24-30, 2025, spot prices for HRC in the U.S. increased to $915/t, up from $910/t the previous week, with thick sheet offered at $1015/t. The increase reflects tightening supply and strong demand in the North American market.

title: CISA Mills' Daily Crude Steel Output Up 0.9 Percent in Mid-November 2025, Stocks Also Up
summary: China's large and medium-sized steel enterprises saw a 0.9% increase in daily crude steel output in mid-November 2025, with finished steel inventories rising by 0.8%. The trend indicates a slight recovery in production after earlier declines.

title: Rising mill output creates ferrous market anticipation
summary: U.S. steel mills have increased their output recently, producing nearly 1.76 million tons of raw steel in the week ending November 8, 2025, with a capacity utilization rate of 76.7%, a 9.1% increase from the same week in 2024. Despite higher production, recycled steel prices remain steady to downward due to weak export demand and ample inventories in East Asia.

title: CISA mills' daily crude steel output up 0.9 percent in mid-November 2025, stocks also up
summary: The China Iron and Steel Association reported that average daily crude steel output of large and medium-sized steel enterprises in China rose by 0.9% in mid-November 2025 compared to early November, reaching 1.943 million metric tons. Finished steel inventories also increased by 0.8% to 15.61 million metric tons as of November 20.

title: Steelmaker Nam Kim to explore tin-nickel coated steel production for EV battery shells
summary: Vietnamese steelmaker Nam Kim plans to develop tin-nickel coated steel for electric vehicle battery shells through joint ventures with technologically capable partners. The company reported a revenue decline of 27% in Q3 2025 due to weaker market demand but is focusing on innovation in steel products for EV applications.

title: Belgium increased steel production by 3.4% m/m in October 2025
summary: Belgium's steel production rose by 3.4% month-over-month in October 2025. Other notable steel market developments include Spain's 5.4% year-over-year production increase in the first half of 2025, Turkey's 8.3% production decrease in June, and ArcelorMittal's temporary blast furnace shutdown in Poland due to import pressures.

title: Green Steel at a Crossroads: IEEFA Says India Needs Smarter Public Financing to Drive Decarbonisation and Energy Security
summary: India requires strategic deployment of public capital to bridge the financing gap for green steel projects and prevent carbon lock-in. The article emphasizes the importance of targeted public finance mechanisms to scale green steel production and promote sustainable steelmaking for the country's future energy security.

title: Copper Firms on Codelco Premium Push
summary: Copper prices rose to 5.19 USD/lb on November 28, 2025, up 2.15% from the previous day, as Chilean producer Codelco offered record-high premiums to Chinese buyers, signaling a shift in market dynamics. The move reinforces a bullish outlook due to a fragile supply-demand balance and expectations of further US Federal Reserve rate cuts.

title: METALS-Copper breaks above $11,000 on increased likelihood of US rate cut
summary: Benchmark copper on the London Metal Exchange surpassed $11,000 per metric ton, driven by expectations of imminent US rate cuts and tightening supply. Analysts highlight ongoing supply challenges, low inventories, and a growing deficit in copper concentrate, which could push prices higher into 2026.

title: Copper price in London hits new high amid bullish calls
summary: Copper prices in London reached a record high of $11,210.50 per ton amid bullish sentiment from industry leaders at an Asia gathering, citing tightening supply and the risk of global copper cathode shortages. US copper futures also surged, reflecting strong demand and supply disruptions.

title: US November PCE Lower than Expected, Copper Price Running at Highs
summary: LME copper prices rose overnight to a high of $10,450 per metric ton, supported by weaker-than-expected US PCE data and expectations of rate cuts. The market remains tight, with prices reflecting ongoing supply constraints and strong demand.

title: Copper Market Outlook
summary: J.P. Morgan forecasts copper prices to rise to $12,500 per metric ton in Q2 2026, driven by severe supply disruptions and a projected global refined copper deficit. The market is expected to remain tight, with higher prices likely to persist through 2026.

title: Copper smelting activity slows in China
summary: Global copper smelting activity fell in October 2025, with the inactive world capacity estimated at 15.1%, largely due to a sharp decline in China where inactivity rose by 6.9%. Maintenance downtime at two Chinese smelters and low activity in North, Northeast, and Northwest China contributed to this slowdown, while smelting activity outside China increased by 2.2% in October. Despite this, global refined copper production grew by about 4.3% through the first nine months of 2025 compared to 2024.

title: Copper Market Outlook
summary: Severe supply disruptions, including a fatal mudslide at Indonesia's Grasberg mine and downgraded production at Chile's Quebrada Blanca mine, have tightened the copper market and driven prices higher. J.P. Morgan projects copper prices to reach $12,500/mt in Q2 2026, with a global refined copper deficit of approximately 330,000 metric tons expected in 2026. The report highlights ongoing supply challenges and potential constraints on Chinese refined copper production.

title: Copper tensions run high with global market at 'historic point'
summary: The global copper market is experiencing significant upheaval due to supply-demand imbalances and China's shifting role. The US is expected to hold 90% of global copper inventories by early 2026, exacerbating shortages elsewhere. While China's copper demand is currently subdued due to economic challenges, supply acceleration from new mine projects in the US, Canada, and Chile may ease pressures, alongside potential copper substitution efforts.

title: TC/RC Market Breakdown & Copper Supply Realignment
summary: Copper concentrate supply tightness is structural due to mine disruptions, declining ore grades, and permitting delays, making concentrate availability the main constraint on refined copper production globally. China continues to expand smelting capacity despite falling treatment charges, producing 9.7% more refined copper through October 2025. New projects like Marimaca Copper in Chile show promise with strong economic returns and high-grade mineralization.

title: Denarius Metals Announces Details for the November 30, 2025 Interest Payments
summary: Denarius Metals reported ongoing mining operations at its Zancudo Project in Colombia and holds interests in several critical mineral projects in Spain, including the Aguablanca nickel-copper mine and the Lomero polymetallic deposit. The company is advancing its portfolio with a focus on copper and other critical minerals, supporting supply amid global demand.

title: A new copper target discovered at Storm
summary: A regional soil sampling program at the Storm project has identified and defined a new copper target across eight prospective areas, indicating potential for further exploration and development in the region.

title: Foran Mining advances rare tier-one copper asset in Saskatchewan
summary: Foran Mining is progressing its tier-one copper asset in Saskatchewan, with plans for feasibility studies and construction targeted for 2027 and 2028 respectively, highlighting ongoing development in copper production capacity in North America.

title: Super Copper and MetaFLO Announce Joint Venture to Develop Biopolymer Solutions for Copper Mining
summary: Super Copper and MetaFLO have formed a joint venture to co-develop innovative, eco-friendly biopolymer solutions aimed at improving copper extraction and remediation. These biopolymers are designed to reduce environmental impact, optimize operational efficiency, and support regulatory compliance in copper mining, with pilot testing planned in Chile.

title: Codelco and NTT DATA Sign Strategic Alliance to Accelerate Digital and Sustainable Transformation of Future Mining
summary: Codelco, the world’s leading copper producer, and NTT DATA have signed a memorandum of understanding to collaborate on integrating advanced technologies such as AI, digital twins, and quantum computing to enhance safety, sustainability, and productivity in copper mining operations. This strategic alliance aims to drive innovation and sustainable development in the mining industry.

title: Seeking the Next Big Idea: Pitch at Innovation Hour, Copper to the World 2025
summary: Austmine invites innovators to present solutions at Innovation Hour during Copper to the World 2025, focusing on deep copper mining and copper processing innovations. The event emphasizes sustainability, efficiency, and environmental responsibility, encouraging technologies like bioleaching, AI, and novel processing methods to support the copper industry's decarbonization and electrification goals.

title: Nano Copper Oxide Market Growth: Innovation-Driven Strategy Insights
summary: The global nano copper oxide market is expanding due to its superior energy storage capacity, catalytic properties, and applications in electronics, batteries, and solar technologies. Innovations in nano copper oxide are improving battery performance in electric vehicles and portable devices, while also offering antimicrobial and pigmenting functions in coatings.

title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
summary: Nickel prices fell 1.8% to $15,235 a ton on the London Metal Exchange, hitting a four-year low. The decline is driven by a gloomy outlook from the Federal Reserve and concerns over oversupply despite Indonesia's potential mining quota cuts. The metal has dropped about 8% this year due to new supply from Indonesia and slower electric vehicle sales.

title: Indonesia's Nickel Supply & The Global Price Slump - What the Market Sell-Off Signals for Investors
summary: Nickel prices have fallen to around $14,550 per tonne, near a four-year low, due to Indonesia's refinery expansions flooding the market and a surge in LME inventories by 90,000 tonnes in 2025. Despite announced quota cuts, market skepticism remains about their effectiveness in tightening supply. The price slump pressures high-cost producers and may delay new projects, while EV battery demand offers some long-term support.

title: Analysis: Nickel giants under pressure
summary: Nickel futures prices have become increasingly volatile and trended downward to about $14,550 in November, one of the lowest levels since early 2021. Despite Indonesia cutting nickel mining quotas by 120 million tonnes this year, oversupply persists, as evidenced by rising LME inventories exceeding 250,000 tonnes. This suggests the global market remains saturated and price weakness may continue.

title: Nickel has a future despite low prices
summary: Nickel prices are at a five-year low, down 9.5% year-on-year, reaching levels not seen since October 2020. Oversupply remains a key issue despite government regulations restricting new smelter investments and planned ore output quota cuts for 2026. Stainless steel demand remains subdued, especially in Asia, but the long-term outlook is supported by growth in electric vehicle markets.

title: Nickel Price Update: Q3 2025 in Review
summary: Nickel prices were volatile in the first half of 2025 but stabilized somewhat in Q3 amid ongoing oversupply concerns primarily driven by rapid production growth in Indonesia. Despite solid demand growth, the market remains structurally oversupplied, pressuring prices. Seasonal output declines may provide temporary relief, but significant supply-side adjustments are needed to improve prices.

title: Steelmaker Nam Kim to explore tin-nickel coated steel production for EV battery shells
summary: Vietnamese steelmaker Nam Kim has approved a plan to assess the feasibility of producing tin-nickel coated steel for electric vehicle battery shells. The company aims to leverage existing production capabilities and invest in new equipment, with future plans to collaborate with technically capable partners through joint ventures.

title: Nickel Hits 31-week Low as Oversupply Mounts
summary: Nickel prices have dropped to a 31-week low due to persistent oversupply, mainly driven by Indonesia's expanded production. Despite regulatory moves to restrict new refining permits, supply remains high, with LME warehouse stockpiles increasing significantly this year.

title: Re-energising the nickel industry through sustainable battery production
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals is advancing sustainable nickel production through its TECH Project, which will process high-grade nickel laterite ore imported from New Caledonia using the patented DNi Process™. The project aims to be carbon negative and supply ethically derived nickel and cobalt for EV and energy storage industries, with binding offtake agreements in place with LG Energy Solution and POSCO.

title: The Future of Nickel Alloy Innovations in Sustainable Manufacturing
summary: Nickel alloys are driving sustainable manufacturing by improving battery performance and longevity, reducing environmental footprints in industries such as automotive, aerospace, and energy. Innovations focus on advanced processing and recycling to create lighter, stronger, and corrosion-resistant alloys, which help reduce resource consumption and carbon emissions.

title: Strengthen Indonesia's Global Nickel Leadership, PT Vale Indonesia and Huayou Commits to Climate-Aligned Technology Pathways at COP30
summary: PT Vale Indonesia is implementing technological innovations such as heat recovery, off-gas utilization, and electrification to reduce absolute emissions by 33% and carbon intensity by 50% by 2030. These efforts support climate goals and operational efficiencies, positioning Indonesia as a leader in responsible, low-carbon nickel production.

title: BYD's Blade Battery: Reducing Reliance on Nickel and Cobalt
summary: BYD's Blade Battery innovation reduces reliance on nickel and cobalt, lowering ecological damage from mining and supporting sustainability goals. The company aims for carbon neutrality by 2045 and significant carbon intensity reductions by 2030, with initiatives including recycling and reuse of packaging materials to reduce industrial waste.

title: Climate-friendly metals can come from deep-sea ores
summary: A new process using hydrogen reduction to extract nickel, cobalt, and copper from deep-sea ores can reduce CO2 emissions by over 90% compared to traditional carbon-based methods. This technology also requires less energy and fewer steps, offering a more sustainable approach to meeting the growing demand for critical metals in battery production.

title: Tenaris Announces Second Tranche of USD 600 Million Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris has initiated the second tranche of its USD 1.2 billion share buyback program, purchasing up to USD 600 million of its shares starting November 3, 2025, through a financial institution. The buyback is part of a broader program authorized by shareholders and will result in the cancellation of repurchased shares.

title: Tenaris to Commence a USD 600 million Second Tranche of its USD 1.2 Billion Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris announced the start of the second tranche of its share buyback program, which will run from November 3, 2025, to April 30, 2026. The program involves the purchase of up to USD 600 million in shares, with trading decisions made independently by a financial institution.

title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
summary: Prysmian SpA raised its full-year 2025 guidance after reporting third-quarter revenue of €5.03 billion, 3% higher than consensus. The Italian cable manufacturer's strong results were driven by exceptional performance in its Renewable Transmission unit (39% organic growth) and Power Grids segment (15% organic growth), with analysts noting the company is well-positioned to benefit from copper tariffs in 2026.

title: Prysmian Raises Annual Targets After Record Q3 Performance
summary: Italian group Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 guidance following a historically strong third-quarter financial performance. The company's revenue and operational metrics exceeded expectations across multiple segments, reflecting robust demand in renewable transmission and power grid infrastructure.
